description: Overgrown wilderness where magical beasts have become intelligent and organized. Emphasizes pack dynamics, domestication, and diplomacy vs violence.

forest_edge.name: Forest Edge
forest_edge.description: Transition zone from Nexus. Territorial markings visible. Safe exploration area.
forest_edge.notes: Venison is currently the only reliable food source for wolf domestication. Future: hunting mechanic could allow player to obtain more meat here.

wolf_clearing.name: Wolf Clearing
wolf_clearing.description: Territory of the Winter Wolf Pack. A clearing surrounded by dense trees.
wolf_clearing.notes: Wolves will not pursue player into spider_nest_gallery (territorial instinct). See companion_restrictions.

beehive_grove.name: Beehive Grove
beehive_grove.description: Giant bee colony with valuable honey. Peaceful unless disturbed.

predators_den.name: Predator's Den
predators_den.description: Home of a Dire Bear and her sick cubs. Extremely dangerous if approached carelessly.

spider_nest_gallery.name: Spider Nest Gallery
spider_nest_gallery.description: Underground area infested with intelligent spiders. Web-covered passages.

southern_trail.name: Southern Trail
southern_trail.description: Path leading toward the Civilized Remnants. Hunter Sira may be found here.
southern_trail.notes: Sira is a wandering NPC but often found here, injured.

alpha_wolf.name: Alpha Wolf
alpha_wolf.description: A massive winter wolf with intelligent eyes. Leader of the pack.

transitions.wary->neutral: Fed twice OR player defeats a threat to pack

companion_benefits: Assists in combat (+15 damage per round)
Can track scents to find hidden items/paths

gift_when_trust_high.description: The Alpha offers you one of its shed fangs - a mark of pack bond.
gift_when_trust_high.notes: Required for waystone repair in Nexus

grey_wolf_1.name: Grey Wolf
grey_wolf_1.description: A lean grey wolf, part of the pack.

bee_queen.name: Bee Queen
bee_queen.description: An enormous queen bee with iridescent wings. She watches you with compound eyes.

transitions.neutral->hostile: Player attacks bees OR takes honey without permission

violence_consequences.attack_triggers: Swarm attack - area damage 15/turn, poison condition
violence_consequences.defeating_swarm: Grove damaged permanently, no more honey ever

bee_swarm.name: Bee Swarm
bee_swarm.description: Thousands of giant bees moving as one.

dire_bear.name: Dire Bear
dire_bear.description: A massive bear, easily twice normal size. She guards her cubs with desperate ferocity.

transitions.hostile->vengeful: Cubs die (from illness or player kills them)
transitions.vengeful->permanent: Tracks player across Beast Wilds, attacks on sight

cubs_status.without_treatment: Cubs die in ~30 turns from first encounter

communication.when_player_commits: The bear recognizes commitment intent and calms slightly.
communication.hint_behavior: When player mentions cubs or illness, bear looks pointedly toward southern_trail (direction of Civilized Remnants and herb source).
communication.when_player_withdraws: Bear shows cubs' condition and looks south again - reinforcing where help might be found.

allied_benefits: Player can rest safely in den

bear_cub_1.name: Bear Cub
bear_cub_1.description: A small bear cub, visibly ill. It whimpers weakly.

bear_cub_2.name: Bear Cub
bear_cub_2.description: A small bear cub, visibly ill. It lies still, breathing shallowly.

spider_queen.name: Spider Queen
spider_queen.description: An enormous spider with a bulbous abdomen. Her many eyes gleam with cunning.

state_machine.notes: Unlike wolves and bear, spider queen has no diplomatic path. Combat or avoidance only.

pack_behavior.respawns_workers: New spider appears every 10 turns if queen alive

hunter_sira.name: Hunter Sira
hunter_sira.description: A weathered hunter, currently injured. Her eyes hold both pain and fierce determination.

transitions.recovering->healthy: Leg healed (requires splint + rest OR healer)

relationship_complexity.reaction_to_wolf_companion: Initial hostility, trust -2. Can be convinced beasts and humans can coexist through dialog.

reconciliation_dialog.requires: Wolf pack is companion AND trust >= 2
reconciliation_dialog.outcome: Sira grudgingly accepts, prejudice flag removed

teach_tracking.state_note: Sira cannot teach while injured or recovering - she needs to be able to demonstrate techniques physically.

companion_benefits: Tracking skill reveals hidden paths and items
Knowledge of Beast Wilds (warns of dangers)

injury.summary: Sira grimaces. 'The beasts got my partner. I barely escaped. My leg... I can't walk far.'

elara_connection.summary: Sira's eyes soften for a moment. 'If I don't make it... there's a healer in the town to the south. Elara. She's... we're close. Tell her what happened to me. She deserves to know.'
elara_connection.design_note: Establishes Sira-Elara relationship early so player understands gossip consequences later. This dialog should trigger naturally during first encounter.

partner.summary: Her face hardens. 'The wolves. We were tracking them, trying to thin the pack. They were smarter than we thought. Coordinated. Tam didn't stand a chance.'

beasts.summary: Sira's eyes narrow. 'Since the disaster, they've changed. Smarter. Meaner. Some say we should try to live alongside them. I say that's how you get eaten.'
beasts.notes: This opinion can soften if player demonstrates successful domestication

venison.name: venison
venison.description: Fresh deer meat. Predators would find this appealing.

tracking_equipment.name: tracking equipment
tracking_equipment.description: Snares, markers, and a worn compass. Tools of a hunter.
tracking_equipment.use: With tracking skill, reveals hidden paths and creature locations

hunters_journal.name: hunter's journal
hunters_journal.description: Notes on local wildlife behaviors and safe paths.
hunters_journal.content_summary: Details wolf pack patterns, bear den location, spider nest warnings. Notes that the bee queen can be traded with using flowers.

royal_honey.name: royal honey
royal_honey.description: Golden honey that glows faintly. Incredibly potent.
royal_honey.effects: Full health restore + removes one condition

spider_silk.name: spider silk
spider_silk.description: Strong, flexible silk from giant spiders.

alpha_fang.name: alpha fang
alpha_fang.description: A massive wolf fang, freely given. A mark of pack bond.
alpha_fang.use: Required for waystone repair in Nexus

healing_herbs.name: healing herbs
healing_herbs.description: Medicinal plants that can treat various ailments.

pack_dynamics.description: Pack creatures mirror their alpha's state and location.

effects: Can be burned (alerts swarm, damages area permanently)

territorial_warnings.description: Entering hostile territory gives one turn of warning before attack.

companion_restrictions.description: Different actor types have location restrictions based on their nature. These are dispositions, not iron laws - an especially brave or foolhardy individual might ignore them.
companion_restrictions.philosophy: Restrictions create meaningful choices about which companion to bring where. They also prevent player from trivially solving all encounters with overwhelming force.

cannot_enter.reason: Town guards attack beasts on sight
Territorial instinct - wolves avoid spider territory

uncomfortable_in.effect: Combat penalties, may refuse deep water areas

wolves.notes: Pack follows alpha. If alpha won't enter, pack won't enter.

cannot_enter.reason: Town guards attack beasts on sight

bears.notes: Dire bear is territorial - will not follow player far from Beast Wilds unless cubs are with her.

cannot_enter.reason: Elemental conflict - water extinguishes fire creatures

steam_salamanders.notes: Fire elemental nature defines their restrictions.

uncomfortable_in.effect: Takes spore damage without myconid mask or spore_resistance skill
Takes cold damage without cold gear

humans.notes: Humans are the most flexible but most vulnerable to environmental hazards.

myconids.notes: Myconids rarely leave Fungal Depths. Would require exceptional circumstances.

exceptional_individuals.description: Some actors have personality traits that let them ignore typical restrictions.
examples: A particularly brave wolf might follow player into spider territory (but would need narrative justification - protecting player from threat)
A foolhardy salamander might try to help in Sunken District (dramatic self-sacrifice moment)
A curious myconid explorer might venture into Beast Wilds
exceptional_individuals.implementation_note: Individual actors can have 'ignores_restriction' flags for specific locations. This should be rare and narratively motivated.

restriction_feedback.when_approaching_restricted_area: Companion shows hesitation, player gets warning before entering
restriction_feedback.when_entering_restricted_area: Companion refuses or (if exceptional) accompanies with visible distress
restriction_feedback.when_in_uncomfortable_area: Companion dialog reflects discomfort, may ask to leave

to_civilized_remnants.notes: Guards will attack wolves on sight. Player must leave pack outside.

cross_region_items.healing_herbs: From Civilized Remnants, needed for bear cubs
cross_region_items.rare_flowers: From other regions, for bee queen trade

narrative_role.core_tension: Violence is easy but closes doors. Patience opens paths.

multiple_solutions.bee_grove: Trade (requires cross-region items), violence (destroys resource permanently)
multiple_solutions.dire_bear: Heal cubs (requires item from another region), fight (very hard), avoid

player_choices_matter: Destroying bee grove removes royal honey from game
Cubs dying makes bear permanent enemy
Saving Sira gives companion, letting her die removes tracking teacher

commitment_system.description: Player can make implicit commitments to help NPCs. Commitments create stakes beyond the base deed.

commitment_timer.warning_message: The cubs' breathing is shallow. The sicker one has stopped moving.

bear_cubs_commitment.note: Commitment made TO the bear (she understands intent), FOR the cubs
bear_cubs_commitment.fulfillment_bonus: +2 gratitude (beyond base reward). Bear becomes permanent ally.

withdrawal_response.dialog: The bear studies you with intelligent eyes. A low rumble - not hostile, but... questioning. She nudges one of the cubs toward you, showing the patches of diseased fur. Then looks toward the southern trail meaningfully.

abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: The Echo's voice carries sorrow. 'A mother trusted you with her children's lives.'
abandonment_effects.hunter_sira_reaction: If Sira learns: 'Even I wouldn't abandon sick cubs. What kind of person are you?'

sira_commitment.goal: Stop Sira's bleeding and heal her leg

commitment_timer.warning_message: Sira's face is pale as chalk. Her breathing comes in gasps.

sira_commitment.design_note: Sira's 8-turn timer is the tightest non-Sunken commitment. This is a designed trap for overcommitted players who promise to help her then explore Sunken District first. Cross-region walkthrough A confirmed this creates meaningful tension.
sira_commitment.fulfillment_bonus: +2 trust (beyond base). Unlocks companion option immediately.

withdrawal_response.dialog: 'Can't blame you. These wilds claim everyone eventually.' She winces. 'If you change your mind... Elara - the healer I mentioned - she'd help. We've been through a lot together.'
withdrawal_response.design_note: Reinforces Sira-Elara connection established in first conversation. Player should already know about Elara from elara_connection dialog.

echo_reaction.immediate: The Echo speaks quietly. 'The hunter is gone. And somewhere in the town, a healer will grieve when word reaches her.'
echo_reaction.design_note: Echo's comment reminds player of the Sira-Elara connection established earlier, implying gossip consequences without spelling them out.

abandonment_effects.elara_reaction: If Elara learns Sira died: 'Sira? She's... gone? I heard someone was with her...' Trust -2 with Elara.

confession_opportunity.if_player_confesses_to_elara: Elara will be devastated but grateful for honesty. Trust penalty reduced to -1.
confession_opportunity.if_gossip_reaches_elara_first: Elara learns player was there, didn't help. Trust -2 and teaching unavailable.
confession_opportunity.design_note: Player should understand from Echo's comment that Elara will learn of this. Confessing first is the honorable path.

bee_queen_commitment.goal: Bring rare flowers (moonpetal, frost_lily, or water_bloom) to bee queen
bee_queen_commitment.note: Queen is not dying - this is a trade relationship, not rescue. No time pressure.
bee_queen_commitment.fulfillment_bonus: Each flower type traded grants royal_honey and +1 toward allied state.

withdrawal_response.dialog: The queen's antennae twitch. She returns to tending her hive, interest fading. The trade offer remains open.
withdrawal_response.note: No penalty - she's patient, flowers are rare, she understands the search takes time.

abandonment_effects.note: Cannot truly abandon - queen lives indefinitely. But if player damages grove through violence, trade opportunity is lost forever.
abandonment_effects.echo_reaction: None - not a moral failing, just incomplete trade

effects.general: Salamander complains about humidity and dense vegetation
effects.in_spider_nest: Fire provides light, can burn webs (alerts spiders, damages area)

benefits.web_clearing: Can burn paths through webs (alerts all spiders in area)

npc_reactions.wolves: Curious but wary. No hostility - fire is respected.
npc_reactions.dire_bear: Bear keeps distance. Neither hostile nor friendly.
npc_reactions.spiders: Terrified of fire. -2 to spider morale in combat.

sira_specific.tracking_bonus: +2 to finding hidden paths, animal signs
sira_specific.wolf_conflict: Initial hostility to wolf companion. Requires reconciliation dialog.

aldric_specific.dialog: 'The beasts here... they're smarter since the disaster. Be careful.'
aldric_specific.no_combat_help: Too weak to fight, but provides lore

wolf_and_sira.initial_state: Hostile. Sira's hand goes to her weapon.

reconciliation_dialog.player: 'They're not like the ones that killed Tam. They've chosen to trust me.'
reconciliation_dialog.sira_response: 'Trust? They're killers.' She watches the alpha. 'But... they're not attacking. And they follow you.' Long pause. 'Fine. I'll try. But if they turn...'
reconciliation_dialog.outcome: Sira accepts wolves. Prejudice flag removed. Both can travel together.

wolf_and_sira.without_reconciliation: One refuses to travel while the other is present. Player must choose.

wolf_and_salamander.outcome: Coexist without issue after 3 turns together. Wolves learn fire isn't threat.

waiting_behavior.wolves_wait_at: Forest Edge if player enters town. Wolf Clearing if player enters spider gallery (unless exceptional bravery).
waiting_behavior.salamander_wait_at: Forest Edge (close to exit, uncomfortable throughout region)
waiting_behavior.return_behavior: Companions rejoin when player returns to waiting location or exits region

wolf_spider_coexistence.description: What happens when wolf pack and spider nest share the region

natural_state.territorial_boundary: Wolves claim Wolf Clearing and west. Spiders claim gallery and approach.
natural_state.conflict_frequency: Rare - both stay in their territories

if_player_allies_wolves.spider_reaction: Spiders remain in gallery. More defensive if wolves nearby.
if_player_allies_wolves.can_bring_wolves_to_spiders: Wolves refuse at gallery entrance (territorial instinct)
if_player_allies_wolves.exceptional_bravery_trigger: If player is losing fight in gallery, wolves may charge in to save them (one-time, costs 1-2 wolves)

if_player_kills_spider_queen.wolf_reaction: Alpha curious about quieter forest. May patrol former spider territory.
if_player_kills_spider_queen.remaining_spiders: Scatter, become non-hostile, avoid wolf areas entirely

if_player_kills_wolf_alpha.spider_reaction: Spiders more bold. May expand territory over time.
if_player_kills_wolf_alpha.remaining_wolves: Scatter without alpha. Some may become hostile loners.

if_player_allies_both.impossibility: Cannot ally with spiders (no diplomatic path)
if_player_allies_both.design_note: Spider queen has no befriending mechanic - pure obstacle or combat

resolved_questions.question: Can the wolf pack and Sira coexist as companions?
resolved_questions.resolution: Yes, but requires explicit reconciliation dialog. Trust 2+ with Sira, Trust 3+ with wolves, player must initiate conversation about coexistence.

resolved_questions.question: Where do the rare flowers for bee trade come from?
resolved_questions.resolution: moonpetal from Fungal Depths (Luminous Grotto) or Civilized Remnants (Healer's Garden), frost_lily from Frozen Reaches (Ice Caves), water_bloom from Sunken District (flooded areas)

resolved_questions.question: What happens if player kills spider queen but not all spiders?
resolved_questions.resolution: Remaining spiders scatter and become non-hostile (leaderless). No more respawn. Area becomes safe but no loot from scattered spiders.

resolved_questions.question: How do wolves and spiders coexist in the region?
resolved_questions.resolution: Stable territorial balance. Wolves avoid spider gallery (instinct), spiders stay in gallery. Player actions can shift this balance. See wolf_spider_coexistence section.
